inlineContent.text: The shown information includes the programs’ logo, name, copyright,
website and license. It is also possible to give credits to the authors,
documenters, translators and artists who have worked on the program.
An about dialog is typically opened when the user selects the
option from the
menu. All parts of the dialog are optional.
About dialogs often contain links and email addresses.
displays these as clickable links. By default, it calls [method
when a user clicks one. The behaviour can be overridden with the
[signal
] signal.
To specify a person with an email address, use a string like
poe.com
. To specify a website with a title,
use a string like
To make constructing a
as convenient as possible, you can
use the function [func
] which constructs and shows
a dialog and keeps it around so that it can be shown again.
Note that GTK sets a default title of
on the dialog
window (where
is replaced by the name of the application, but in
order to ensure proper translation of the title, applications should
set the title property explicitly when constructing a

protocol exposes the methods and properties of an underlying
instance.
The default implementation of these can be found in the protocol extension below.
